value.title: Power BI Course for Beginners (Part 1-Getting to Know Power BI)
value.excerpt: If you are looking for a job and need to learn Power BI this is the perfect course for you. In this course you will learn Power BI using Facebook marketing data. You can get the data set for the course here: https://github.com/Gaelim/Power-BI-Courses/blob/master/fb_campaign.csv
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hhsAdo7UUXc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: 2 ways to rotate Power BI tabs
value.excerpt: If you want to show your power bi report on a TV or web browser and have the tabs rotate at a interval you specify, this video is for you. I will show you two ways to do that.  Link to Google analytics template app: https://appsource.microsoft.com/en-us/product/power-bi/curbal.google-analytics-template-by-curbal?tab=Overview

value.title: #33 Import from PDF into Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In today's video I will show you how to import data from a pdf file into Power BI using Imke Feldmann's R-script.  To download the file, go to Curbal's download center and the communty downloads and get gile #33: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  Install R in Power BI: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HcTdXgWGdS8

value.title: Analyze and visualize your Outlook/Exchange calendar in Power BI
value.excerpt: Where is your time going? Do you feel that you are having too many meetings and not enough time to get your work done? Do you want to check if your gut-feeling is correct?  In todays video I will show you how to import your calendar from Outlook into Power BI and show you one way to visualize it.  Link

value.title: Automatic refresh in Power BI desktop - Power BI desktop update October 2019
value.excerpt: In the october power bi desktop update, they released the possibility to have automatic page refresh for direct queries in power bi desktop and the service too.  Here we go through how it works and what you need to watch out for.  Link to the docs: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/desktop-automatic-page-refresh

value.title: Bulk import data from multiple pages on a website with Power BI Desktop - Power BI Tips & Tricks #04
value.excerpt: Have you come across a website that has data you need but it is presented in multiple pages? Downloading page by page can be frustrating and time consuming. In this short video, I will show you how to iterate multiple pages on a website to import the data using Power BI.  LINK to NFL site: http://www.nfl.com/stats/categorystats?tabSeq=2&offensiveStatisticCategory=TEAM_PASSING&conference=ALL&role=TM&season=2015&seasonType=REG

value.title: Create a bump or slope chart in Power BI -D70
value.excerpt: Bump or slope charts are useful to sport changes between categories. There is no native bump or slope visual in Power BI, but you can create your own easily from a line chart. In this video I show you how. #curbal #power bi #bumpcharts  Here you can download the file (#70) here: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: DAX Fridays! #105: ISINSCOPE
value.excerpt: The DAX function ISINSCOPE, allow us to work with hierarchies in Power BI. In this video I will go through an example on how to do that. This DAX function was introduced in the November 2018 Power BI Desktop Update, so make sure you have that installed if you wan to test it out.  Other resources:  DAX
